data.title: WolfheartFPS: Broken Roads – The Party-Based Post-Apocalyptic RPG You Didn’t Know About
data.meta_description: Discover the unique and immersive world of Broken Roads, a post-apocalyptic RPG set in the Australian Outback.
data.text:
WolfheartFPS recently released a video titled ‘Broken Roads – The Party-Based Post-Apocalyptic RPG You Didn’t Know About’, where he dives into the world of this unique game. Broken Roads is a story-rich RPG set in a post-apocalyptic Australian Outback and offers players a narrative-driven experience with plenty of choices and decisions to be made. One of the game’s defining mechanics is its morality system, which goes beyond just good and evil choices. The moral compass in the game focuses on a character’s philosophical leanings, with four quadrants representing different worldviews. The choices you make in the game will shift your moral compass and unlock dialogue options and perks.

If you enjoy this content, consider subscribing to WolfheartFPS’s YouTube channel!

Key Takeaways:

Broken Roads is a party-based RPG set in a post-apocalyptic Australian Outback.

The game features a unique morality system that goes beyond good and evil choices.

Players’ choices and dialogue options will shift their moral compass and unlock perks.

The game’s hand-drawn art style and setting were created with input from indigenous Elders to authentically represent indigenous Australians.

The Unique Morality System of Broken Roads

In Broken Roads, the morality system goes beyond traditional good and evil choices. The game’s moral compass focuses on a character’s philosophical leanings, with four quadrants representing different worldviews: utilitarian, humanist, Machiavellian, and nihilist. As players make choices and engage in dialogue, their moral compass will shift, unlocking new dialogue options and perks. The more open-minded players are, the more choices they will have, while narrow-minded players will have access to higher-level decisions.

Authentically Representing Indigenous Australians

The development team behind Broken Roads, Dropbeats Studio, worked closely with indigenous Elders to ensure respectful and authentic representation of indigenous Australians in the game. The post-apocalyptic Australia setting is portrayed in a unique hand-drawn art style that captures the essence of the Outback. Players will navigate through various factions and make choices that suit their own survival and goals.

Exploring the World of Broken Roads

In the video, WolfheartFPS takes viewers on a tour of the game’s mechanics and features. Players can create their own character and choose a background that affects attribute bonuses and NPC interactions. The game offers a range of skills and abilities, including a magic system that allows players to harness energy and unleash powerful abilities. Combat encounters are turn-based, with action points and movement points determining the actions players can take. The game also features a cover system and a variety of weapons and equipment to customize your party.

Broken Roads is a unique and immersive RPG set in a post-apocalyptic Australian Outback. With its morality system, hand-drawn art style, and authentic representation of indigenous Australians, the game offers players a compelling narrative-driven experience. Players’ choices and dialogue options will shape their character’s moral compass and unlock perks, adding depth and replayability to the game. If you’re a fan of party-based RPGs and post-apocalyptic settings, Broken Roads is definitely a game to keep an eye on.
